results.title: Atomic medicine
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Burton Benjamin, CBS and Isaac Kleinerman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Among the peaceful uses of the atom is the application of atomic radiation in medical research, diagnosis and treatment. Radiation “tagging and tracing” is a valuable technique in ascertaining the sizes and shapes of various glands such as the thyroid. Treatment of cancers in localized regions of the body is one of the most effective deterrents of the disease. This film points out how continuing research hopes to improve on methods now in use.

results.title: Neutron smashing: the discovery of the atom
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Atomic physics: an historical approach”.
This film shows various instruments used in research, and their diagrammatic explanations; from a very early machine for measuring ionisation, to an electric machine, built after 1932 in the Cavendish laboratory, used to bombard atoms. Includes a speech by Einstein, and an explanation of isotopes and the research leading up to this understanding. No credits available.

results.title: The Atom and industry
results.creator_credit: Warren P. Everote and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how radio-isotopes are providing new techniques of measurement and quality control in a wide variety of industries. Illustrates the following; radio-active “tagging” or identification of batches of crude oil in the petroleum industry; measurement of wear in petrol engines by using radio-active piston rings; measurement and control of thickness of materials produced in sheet form; testing for flaws in casting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warren P. Everote and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: The Atom and archaeology
results.creator_credit: Peter Mertens and Handel Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows how nuclear and radiation techniques, such as carbon-14 dating, thermoluminescence, atomic fingerprinting, and radiography, have helped archeologists discover new facts about the past. Hitherto impenetrable barriers of time are broken, and new data about ancient civilisations revealed. Pioneer work in progress at leading research centres in the USA is shown.

results.title: Atom and agriculture
results.brief_description: The importance, types and principal uses of radio-active isotopes in agricultural research; radio-active cobalt and calcium used to study growth and hereditary characteristics in plants; radio-active carbon-dioxide used to study the chemistry of food production; radio-sulphur used in the study of wool growth; use of radio-active calcium and phosphorous in research work on egg production. No other credits available.

No other credits available.

results.title: Atmosphere and its circulation
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the nature of air, showing its structure, chemical composition, weight and distribution. Its circulation in relation to the Earth, how circulation forms pressure bands and is affected by rotation of the Earth, causing movement or winds; the structure and dynamics of atmosphere are studied with the aid of animated diagrams. No other credits available.
results.description: Demonstrates the nature of air, showing its structure, chemical composition, weight and distribution. No other credits available.

results.title: Atlantic link
results.creator_credit: Jack Greenwood and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: This film traces the laying of the first transatlantic submarine telephone cable, made possible by the cooperation of technologists and engineers in the United Kingdom, the United States and Canada. Describes the routing of landlines on both sides of the Atlantic; the drama and precision involved in the laying of cables between Britain and Newfoundland.
results.description: This film traces the laying of the first transatlantic submarine telephone cable, made possible by the cooperation of technologists and engineers in the United Kingdom, the United States and Canada. results.title: The Athletes (Italian version)
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
The growth of track and field competition in Australia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain. Narration is in the Italian language.

results.title: Athlete: hurdles
results.creator_credit: John Rickword, John Dobson and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Members of the Great Britain Olympic Squad of 1972 demonstrate the techniques of hurdling, then young athletes practise these techniques. Illustrates the analysis and correction of common faults.
